name: Silver Sevens Hotel & Casino

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We received a trip to Las Vegas from a friend and the hotel stay was at Terrible's. The hotel was very gross. We walked into the casino and it didn't look all that bad. After checking in we were told where our room was. The hallways to the rooms was awful. There were stains up and down the wall and on the ceiling. You could smell vomit in the hallway and hear loud television sets going and small children crying (it was scary to think that families were most likely living in that place). The room was good sized and the air conditioner worked well, however the blankets and sheets were stained. The bathroom was not very clean and overall the room was scary. The good news was you could not hear any of the other rooms. The pool looked nice but we didn't really want to venture down to see it. We basically used the room as a changing place and stayed as little as possible. We did order room service one early morning (we were starving after a long night on the strip). The food was horrible, over priced and it took forever to get to our room. I would not recommend this location to anyone.
reviews.title: Terrible's was Terrible
Good Hotel for the Price!
reviews.text: This hotel was average considering the significantly cheaper price for a room versus one on the strip. We stayed here for just one night before moving to another hotel for business. It was sufficient. The rooms were clean. We didn't stay in the "tower" as those were more expensive (and probably a little nicer). If you need a cheap hotel for Vegas, this is the hotel for you.
Terrible's is my one favorite places....outdoor parking good food, but they raise the price of their T-Bone steak and Prime Rib special,,,inflation? Very good value!
reviews.title: Great Value....clean room
Excellent Value for Money
reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel for 2 weeks and found it excellent value for money.

The hotel provides a free shuttle service to and from the airport. Just use the courtesy white telephone in arrivals (Terminal 2) to telephone the hotel to request shuttel. We found this facility excellent.
reviews.title: great little place
nice room
reviews.text: The room was nice, spacious, clean, inexpensive. 2 sources of noise, in the flightpath of the airport, and cars speeding through the parking lot. If we stayed again, I would request a room away from the perimeter of the building.
A 5 minute walk from the Hard Rock, this place is an ideal alternative for those looking to save their money for the blackjack tables (which are usually only $5 minimum here).
reviews.title: Budgeter's Delight

likes.liked: — Right price for room and breakfast
likes.disliked: — Little slow at the check-in counter

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our regular 2 double bed room was clean, spacious, and comfortable, and even had a flat screen TV on the wall. I was very pleased with this hotel, though the check-in took a little longer than it should have.
reviews.title: Good for a budget trip

reviews.text: I will say this hotel is near some seedy spots, but as long as you stay near the casinos, you should be fine. Keep in mind this is a 10-15 minute cab ride from the strip, depending on your itinerary (parking is ample).
reviews.title: Great place for the price

likes.liked: — Nice rooms and staff for the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check out their cheap breakfast buffet - a great deal for early risers or those who come in late.
reviews.title: Nice Tower Room
Great value, average room
reviews.text: Compared to other hotels, this is a 3-star. In terms of value, its a 5-star. Hence my rating of 4-stars.

My wife and I had a choice: either leave before dawn to get in at a decent hour (and save the price of a night's hotel), or take a late flight, crash as soon as we got there, and then move on to another hotel. We chose the latter. Our flight landed at 11 pm, and we checked in at 11:30 pm. The next day, we checked out and switched to the MGM Grand.
reviews.title: Terrible's, Well worth the price

likes.liked: — Prices, especially in the gift shop.
likes.disliked: — No internet access in the rooms (though having free access in the exercise room made up for it)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Terrible's had decent reviews on this website so we decided to go with it. Got a very good price which also included the free all-you-can-eat breakfast. For what we paid, it was an amazing deal.
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check-in was slow. No one was at the counter for 15 minutes (though I note we arrived at 11:30 pm), which was very frustrating. Our room was very big, with a nice 42" plasma tv and a large bed. It was clean but you can tell that at one point someone smoked in it (we are non-smokers), but it wasn't too bad. The bathroom was tiny. Considering we crashed when we got there so we could get an early start the next morning, we had no problems with this room at all.
reviews.title: Great!

reviews.text: Terrible's is about a mile from the strip. I couldn't find the bus stop and taxis don't queue in front of the hotel like the others...they are only there unless they drop someone off. There is a person who will try to flag down cabs, but they don't come by often. Tip: when you're at the airport and take a cab to the hotel, as the driver for a business card of his cab company...it will only take a few minutes for the cab to reach you.
reviews.title: Terrible's - Not Terribly Bad At All

reviews.text: I stayed here one night because I couldn't get a room at the hotel that I wanted the first day of my trip. Since I was arriving late and just wanted a place to sleep, I wanted someplace cheap. This fit the bill.
reviews.title: It's not terrible, but it's definitely low rent

reviews.text: The cigarette smoke will knock you over the moment you open the door to Terrible's. This is a low-rent local's joint, and it's starting to look a little worn.
reviews.title: Great Stay from April 16-19 2008

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are decent sized. They're a little dark - the lighting could be a bit brighter. There's a 52" plasma TV on the wall, but they've engraved the front of the TV with "THCLV" on the front to discourage people from walking out the door with it. The shower was hot and the bed was fairly comfortable.
reviews.title: Great Place Great Food Great Deal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The 24 hour coffee shop has some cheap breakfast specials before 7:00 in the morning. I think my steak and eggs was $7.99, and it was tasty.
reviews.title: briiliant stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you don't mind feeling like a total low-roller, you can get an acceptable room here really cheap.
reviews.title: Fine for the price

description: Italian Tuscany-style resort - corner of Flamingo & Paradise, less then 2 mi from The Strip.
